              [
                "Variables declared both with "
              ],
              [
                "var",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " and "
              ],
              [
                "let",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " are "
              ],
              [
                "hoisted",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "http://stackoverflow.com/documentation/javascript/480/scope/1576/hoisting#t=201607211958234904044"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ". The difference is that a variable declared with "
              ],
              [
                "var",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " can be referenced before its own assignment, since it gets automatically assigned (with "
              ],
              [
                "undefined",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " as its value), but "
              ],
              [
                "let",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " cannot–it specifically requires the variable to be declared before being invoked:"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }

          "id": "2c4900ad-e4c7-4bb3-b454-e5f24d936e79",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1550715467380,
          "parent_id": "fe6c6d61-0cb3-4c73-b092-311369230792",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "The area between the start of a block and a "
              ],
              [
                "let",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " or "
              ],
              [
                "const",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " declaration is known as the "
              ],
              [
                "Temporal Dead Zone",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/let#Temporal_dead_zone_and_errors_with_let"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ", and any references to the variable in this area will cause a "
              ],
              [
                "ReferenceError",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ". This happens even if the "
              ],
              [
                "variable is assigned before being declared",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41451181/does-let-override-a-global-declaration-and-throws-a-referenceerror"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ":"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "In non-strict-mode, "
              ],
              [
                "assigning a value to a variable without any declaration, automatically declares the variable in the global scope",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "http://stackoverflow.com/documentation/javascript/381/strict-mode/7424/changes-to-global-properties#t=201701041227599514039"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ". In this case, instead of "
              ],
              [
                "y",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " being automatically declared in the global scope, "
              ],
              [
                "let",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " reserves the variable’s name ("
              ],
              [
                "y",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ") and does not allow any access or assignment to it before the line where it is declared/initialized."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
